      Based on a set of Cases, finds the attribute that gives the highest information gain This method is fairly ugly, it could definitely be cut down on in length as there is a lot of repeated code, but it is perfectly functional in its current state, just a lot of repetition

        Returns:

                                        double n)
        The Information Content function I(p/p+n, n/p+n) from lecture
        Parameters:

        n - The number of negative examples in the set
        Returns:

      • chooseAttribute

        public static Attribute chooseAttribute(java.util.ArrayList<Case> cases)
        Based on a set of Cases, finds the attribute that gives the highest information gain This method is fairly ugly, it could definitely be cut down on in length as there is a lot of repeated code, but it is perfectly functional in its current state, just a lot of repetition
        Parameters:
        cases - The current subset of the training set
        Returns:
        The attribute with the highest information gain

      • chooseAttributeThreshold

        public static double chooseAttributeThreshold(java.util.ArrayList<Case> cases,
                                              Attribute attribute)
        Based on a set of Cases and an attribute, finds the threshold for that attribute that gives the highest information gain
        Parameters:
        cases - The current subset of the training set
        attribute - The attribute with the highest information gain
        Returns:
        The attribute with the highest information gain
